results.title: [Raymond Penington Home Movies: Reel 6]
results.brief_description:
The Raymond Penington Home Movie Collection is a collection of 16mm colour and black-and-white films made between 1938 and 1965. Dr. Raymond Penington (born 1903) was a medical doctor from Melbourne, Victoria. He and his wife Edith lived in Papua New Guinea in the late 1920s before returning to Melbourne in 1931 and settling in Canterbury. They had three children, Margaret, Vivienne and Jocelyn. His home movies focus on family life in Melbourne and holidays in regional Victoria.

This film shows the construction site during the expansion of the Eildon Dam.

The film shows many construction vehicles including cranes, trucks and bulldozers.

At the beginning of the film we see a crane has fallen over and attempts to raise it up again. However, the conclusion is not seen.

There is also a scene of the Lake Eildon Tower shown almost complete.

Most of the film shows machines redistributing dirt. A sign in the film indicates that 9,000,000 tons of soil was planned to be moved.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:02:00 Big Eildon Project sign
00:00:13:00 view of Eildon Lake
00:00:36:00 scene of crane that has fallen down a bank
00:00:42:00 bulldozers
00:01:07:00 sign indicating Spillway Site - Max Depth 300 Feet – rock excavation 9,000,000 tons
00:01:32:00 loading of dirt onto trucks
00:05:04:00 the Eildon Tower under construction
00:05:37:00 night shot of bulldozer

results.title: [Raymond Penington Home Movies: Reel 1]
results.brief_description:
The Raymond Penington Home Movie Collection is a collection of 16mm colour and black-and-white films made between 1938 and 1965. Dr. Raymond Penington (born 1903) was a medical doctor from Melbourne, Victoria. He and his wife Edith lived in Papua New Guinea in the late 1920s before returning to Melbourne in 1931 and settling in Canterbury. They had three children, Margaret, Vivienne and Jocelyn. His home movies focus on family life in Melbourne and holidays in regional Victoria.

This film shows the Penington family visiting several animal sanctuaries in Victoria, Australia. The film is a good example of animal captivity and fashions of the 1940s.

The film begins at Melbourne Zoo with the zoo entrance (built in 1939). The famous elephant Queenie who gave rides for over 40 years is shown. This would have been shortly before she killed her trainer by accident in 1943 leading to her being put down.

There are a number of scenes with the three Penington girls, Margaret, Viviene and Jocelyn, feeding animals. Scenes of monkeys and wallabies amongst other animals are also shown.

The film then moves to Balwyn Wildlife sanctuary with scenes of a monkey circus, pony and dog show. A baboon in clothes doing tricks appears to be the main attraction.

The film then moves to Badger Creek Sanctuary (later called Healesville sanctuary) where platypuses, emus, eagles and koalas are seen.

The film finishes with seals playing in their enclosure.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:04:00 Melbourne Zoo Entrance
00:00:17:00 Mrs Penington, Margaret, Viviene and Jocelyn walking along garden path at the zoo. Mrs Penington is pushing an old fashioned stroller.
00:00:25:00 Penington girls feeding a number of different animals, riding Queenie the elephant and on the Merry-go-round
00:04:59:00 animals being directed to perform tricks by man with a stick including monkeys, dogs and monkeys riding ponies
00:06:08:00 TITLE: “Wild Life – Balwyn.” followed by numerous animals of the Sanctuary
00:07:12:00 monkey circus
00:08:21:00 baboon in clothes rocking in a rocking chair and rides a bike
00:09:17:00 lyrebird foraging in the forest with sparrows, Badger Creek Sanctuary
00:10:18:00 koala with baby eating in a eucalyptus tree
00:10:54:00 platypuses being hand fed in enclosure
00:12:12:00 seals in enclosure playing

results.title: [Raymond Penington Home Movie Collection]
results.brief_description:
The Raymond Penington Home Movie Collection is a collection of 16mm colour and black-and-white films made between 1938 and 1965. Dr. Raymond Penington (born 1903) was a medical doctor from Melbourne, Victoria. He and his wife Edith lived in Papua New Guinea in the late 1920s before returning to Melbourne in 1931 and settling in Canterbury. They had three children, Margaret, Vivienne and Jocelyn. His home movies focus on family life in Melbourne and holidays in regional Victoria.

This collection was donated to ACMI by the filmmaker’s grandson Simon McCutcheon.

results.title: [Remix: Women in science and technology]
results.brief_description:
This remix is a short film celebrating women in professional roles, including science, technology, aviation, mechanics and farming, sourced from footage in the ACMI Collection.

ACMI gratefully acknowledges the following donors and creators in the compilation of this work: Dried Fruits Australia, Cargill Australia, Australian Wool Innovation Ltd., Rio Tinto, Elenor Peach, Yolanta Simmonds, Dept. of Employment, John Richardson, Wine Australia and Ivan Gaal.

results.title: [Remix: The Races]
results.creator_credit: Dakota Henderson, ACMI Collections and ACMI
results.brief_description:
This short remix of films about horse racing set to music, takes you through from getting ready and arriving at the track, to placing a bet, the race and the result.

This playful short film set to music, is a tribute to some of the activities around the spring racing carnival that takes place in Melbourne during October and November. It captures the race preparations for both people and horses, and shows the mounting yard, the TAB bets, the race call and a punter finding out the winner.

ACMI gratefully acknowledge donor: Ivan Gaal ( Dir., ‘The Punter’, 1978).

results.title: [Remix: Historic Melbourne]
results.brief_description:
This video was created using footage from the ACMI Collection.

The remix features trams and historic landmarks in the City of Melbourne. Selected locations include the Princes Bridge, Flinders Street Station, corner of Spring and Bourke Street, intersection of Flinders and Swanston Street, ‘South Melb’ tram, Flinders Street Station Clocktower from Elizabeth Street, St Paul’s Cathedral, Forum Theatre, ‘Melbourne Public Library’ (State Library of Victoria) and the banks of the Yarra River.

results.title: [Remix: 1956 Melbourne Olympic Games]
results.brief_description:
This remix features footage of the 1956 Melbourne Olympic Games including the Olympic torch relay, opening ceremony at the MCG, various events and some elaborate decorations displayed in the CBD during the games.

The video was made using clips from home movies and professional documentary footage preserved in the ACMI Collection.

results.title: [Nixon Family Home Movies: Reel 3]
results.brief_description:
In the Nixon Family Home Movie Collection, married film enthusiasts Les and Dorothy Nixon have captured their family life from when their children are very young to when they are young adults, at home in Geelong, during wonderful beach holidays at Point Roadknight on the Victorian coast, and when going about their everyday activities, from the 1960s to the 1980s.

The films show life in regional and suburban Victoria at the time: playing in the backyard and bike riding down the street (no helmets of course), lots of tennis, lots of beach and swimming, lots of family visits, birthday parties and family barbeques or picnic gatherings. Along the way, the films also record the distinctive fashion (often handmade) and hairstyles of the 1960s, 1970s and 1980s, through Dorothy Nixon being so stylish a dresser herself, and at the many family weddings across the extended family.

The films are made on Standard 8mm and then Super 8mm film, and are in reasonable condition though a little shaky or damaged at times.

This film is a wonderful composite of the Nixon family’s life enjoying the company of their extended family at weddings, birthday gatherings and at the family holiday homes as well as on their travels to the Gold Coast, Queensland and Eildon Weir, Victoria. We see Karen turn six in the film as well as a great Christmas scene when both children are particularly excited to receive their presents, a watch for Karen and a scooter for Stuart.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:10:00 children on the beach at Portarlington
00:00:52:00 at a zoo
00:02:40:00 wedding with a tall headdress for the bride and bridesmaids in dark pink 1960s style dresses
00:04:10:00 Karen’s first day at school, in her uniform with school bag
00:04:24:00 Stuart on a trike (tricycle) saluting the camera
00:04:40:00 picnic on the beach with lots of extended family members
00:05:00:00 treasure hunt in the sand
00:06:54:00 the children on a farm tractor
00:07:20:00 the cousins of the family in a row at a driveway gate
00:08:19:00 Les, Karen and Stuart walking out of the water at the beach
00:09:49:00 children amusement park on ‘dodgem’ cars
00:11:26:00 Karen and Stuart being rowed in a rowboat, followed by a speedboat rushing past, very close to the shore
00:12:00:00 view of waterfront houses at the Gold Coast
00:12:10:00 TAA airplane taking off at an airport
00:13:27:00 extended family wedding with bridesmaids in what would have been (at the time) a very fashionable and wonderful burnt orange
00:15:28:00 Stuart receiving his Christmas scooter
00:16:00:00 Dorothy and daughter Karen in matching outfits
00:16:25:00 family members gathered under some shady trees at the beach
00:16:47:00 Karen very confidently ‘dinking’ her younger brother Stuart on his new scooter (by giving him a ride)
00:19:27:00 Dorothy and other women in the family laugh as they climb up, and fall on, a steep sand dune
00:20:13:00 Dorothy, Karen and Stuart stand outside their caravan at the beach
00:20:19:00 a family wedding, bridesmaids in purple and sporting some great examples of 1960s hairstyles
00:21:43:00 Karen’s sixth birthday party
00:22:27:00 Karen backstroking through the water
00:23:17:00 family picnic including a woman wearing a wonderful paisley shirt typical of fashion at the time
00:24:40:00 cooking on a vintage three-legged barbeque
00:26:00:00 a birthday party held at a holiday home possibly at Point Roadknight

results.title: [Nixon Family Home Movies: Reel 8]
results.brief_description:
In the Nixon Family Home Movie Collection, married film enthusiasts Les and Dorothy Nixon have captured their family life from when their children are very young to when they are young adults, at home in Geelong, during wonderful beach holidays at Point Roadknight on the Victorian coast, and when going about their everyday activities, from the 1960s to the 1980s.

The films show life in regional and suburban Victoria at the time: playing in the backyard and bike riding down the street (no helmets of course), lots of tennis, lots of beach and swimming, lots of family visits, birthday parties and family barbeques or picnic gatherings. Along the way, the films also record the distinctive fashion (often handmade) and hairstyles of the 1960s, 1970s and 1980s, through Dorothy Nixon being so stylish a dresser herself, and at the many family weddings across the extended family.

The films are made on Standard 8mm and then Super 8mm film, and are in reasonable condition though a little shaky or damaged at times.

This film contains family gatherings for birthdays and weddings as well as Christmas in 1979, a picnic in the Eastern Gardens in Geelong, a trip to Cairns and a tennis tournament in Launceston, Tasmania. There are several gatherings for family birthdays, one of which is Dorothy Nixon’s 50th celebrations.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:05:00 extended family members enjoying a buffet meal at one of the family’s homes
00:00:55:00 family members pose for the camera in a backyard
00:01:36:00 extended family members at a long lunch table
00:02:23:00 arrivals to and/or departures from a family gathering
00:03:28:00 family members at the beach
00:03:43:00 the camera catches family members taking photos of a family gathering
00:04:24:00 filming the photographer
00:04:38:00 Stuart, with a mouth full of braces, grinning at the camera in his school uniform
00:04:49:00 Karen, Stuart and Les in their tennis gear
00:05:06:00 Dorothy in bed with Stuart and Karen visiting
00:05:18:00 a Labrador puppy eating in a garden
00:05:42:00 one of the family infants pretends to drink from a beer bottle at a family gathering
00:06:32:00 Les caught on camera at a sunny family picnic or barbeque gathering
00:07:30:00 shorts and long socks: a 1970s fashion look
00:07:57:00 at the barbeque
00:08:33:00 a family birthday party
00:09:30:00 views around the Nixon family home
00:09:58:00 birthday party inside the house
00:11:13:00 the extended family picnicking in a park
00:12:38:00 the 1970s three legged barbeque
00:12:52:00 feeding bread to the seagulls
00:13:50:00 views of the large family picnic including a 1960s green picnic case
00:14:50:00 views of children at the family picnic in the park
00:15:51:00 playing cricket at the picnic
00:16:44:00 looking out over scenery to some mountains
00:17:25:00 Dorothy walking by a palm tree in a lush park followed by a waterfall
00:18:06:00 filming from a train travelling through mountainous green countryside including waterfalls
00:18:45:00 arriving at Kuranda Rail Station in north Queensland.
00:18:53:00 views of orchids at the ‘Tropical Orchid Gardens at Beautiful Tinaroo’
00:20:52:00 waterbirds
00:21:12:00 ‘Ben Cropp’s Shipwreck Museum’
00:21:24:00 boats along a pier
00:21:31:00 feeding – and teasing – a crocodile for a rapt audience at an animal park
00:22:26:00 up close to some cassowaries at an animal park
00:23:50:00 a yellow sightseeing vessel sitting at the pier followed by views of the ocean floor through the glass bottom of the boat
00:25:11:00 a sandy shallow beach
00:25:40:00 Dorothy sitting on a rocky beach and in close up
00:25:54:00 a crocodile and some sharks in separate small enclosures
00:26:05:00 a motel swimming pool setting
00:26:35:00 motor boating down a river
00:27:40:00 fields under cultivation and a tourist bus
00:27:53:00 a rocky cascading river
00:27:59:00 a view looking across the wing of a ‘Qantas VH-TJO Lorikeet’ airplane
00:28:09:00 teenage Stuart in the backyard at home and with Dorothy
00:28:26:00 Stuart being camera shy in an airport waiting room
00:29:13:00 ‘Ansett VH-RMO Boeing 727’ airplane taking off
